Help:Node.Log:Description:
Title: Rooms
Important Commands: drop, enter, examine, look, place, put, take
Rooms are the center of $(theatre.gamebrief). They're the areas that you'll constantly inhabit, where you'll meet other people, find objects, and advance plots. In $(theatre.gamebrief), the word "rooms" means more than just a place with four walls, a ceiling, a floor, and a door. A courtyard or a hallway or even a portion of a larger chamber can all be a room.
You can investigate a room ($(udat.chatchar)LOOK or $(udat.chatchar)EXAMINE) or investigate individual details of a room ($(udat.chatchar)EXAMINE TAPESTRY or $(udat.chatchar)LOOK UNDER TABLE).
You can move from one room to another by typing a direction that leads to an exit ($(udat.chatchar)NORTH) or by entering a door ($(udat.chatchar)ENTER NORTH GATE).
You can move around inside a room by approaching objects or details ($(udat.chatchar)STAND BY NORTH WALL, $(udat.chatchar)LIE UNDER TRESTLE TABLE).
You can move objects around a room ($(udat.chatchar)TAKE SWORD, $(udat.chatchar)PLACE SWORD ON ALTAR, $(udat.chatchar)DROP CANDLE, $(udat.chatchar)PUT CHEST UNDER BED).
See Also: Details, Manipulation, Movement, Perception, Proximity
